name: (1Z)-1-[(2E)-1-benzyl-3-phenyl-2-(phenylhydrazono)propylidene]-2-phenylhydrazine
source: Karthikeyan M.; Glen R.C.; Bender A. General melting point prediction based on a diverse compound dataset and artificial neural networks. J. Chem. Inf. Model.; 2005; 45(3); 581-960
Reason: 1-benzyl-3-phenyl-2-(phenylhydrazono)propylidene and 2-phenylhydrazine have different functional groups, which will affect their melting point. The basic unit for comparison is benzene, which has a melting point of 5.5 degrees Celsius. The phenyl group in the compound introduces a rigid structure and additional molecular weight, estimated at +20 degrees Celsius. The benzyl group introduces additional rigidity and molecular weight, estimated at +10 degrees Celsius. The hydrazono group introduces additional rigidity and hydrogen bonding potential, estimated at +5 degrees Celsius. The phenyl group in the hydrazine ring introduces additional rigidity and molecular weight, estimated at +5 degrees Celsius. The propylidene group introduces additional rigidity and molecular weight, estimated at +5 degrees Celsius. The presence of two methoxy groups can raise the melting point by about +2 degrees Celsius due to additional molecular weight and the capacity for hydrogen bonding. The ketone group introduces additional rigidity and hydrogen bonding potential, estimated at +5 degrees Celsius. The carbonyl group introduces additional rigidity and hydrogen bonding potential, estimated at +5 degrees Celsius. The presence of two methoxy groups can raise the melting point by about +2 degrees Celsius due to additional molecular weight and the capacity for hydrogen bonding.
